sjosmooth 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • sm.coxph()
    • Theory and Methods
  • Changelog

Univariate and multivariable kernel smoothing.

The purpose of this function is to provide kernel-smoothed estimates for n-dimensional data. For example, using two predictors, x and y, to predict an outcome. The program provides an estimated hyperplane of the outcome by x and y.

sm.regress(formula, data, newdata, type, model.FUN, bandwidth = 0.8,
  lambda = NULL, kernel = c("epanechnikov", "tricube", "gaussian", "flat"),
  dist.method = "euclidean", quantile = NULL, verbose = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

formula

The formula call for the model. For exampe, survival::coxph(formula = Surv(time, dead) ~ x + y). Do not include transformed variables in the formula (e.g. Surv(time, dead) ~ log(x) + y)--the specified lambda will no longer be interpretable.
data

A data.frame or tibble with named columns.
newdata

A data.frame or tibble with named columns. Predictions will only be estimated at these points, if specified.
type

Specifies the type of statistic that will be calculated. For example, from a Cox model, you may request survival or expected.
model.FUN

Specifies the type of model that will be used for the estimation Default is coxph.
bandwidth

The proportion of data to be included in each kernel-smoothed estimate. Univariate models only.
lambda

The radius of the kernel for tri-cubic, Epanechnikov, and flat kernels. The standard deviation for the Gaussian kernel.
kernel

Specifies the kernel to be used: epanechnikov, tricube, gaussian, and flat are accepted. Default is epanechnikov. See vignettes for differences in methods.
dist.method

Specifies the distance measure to be used in the kernel. Default is euclidean. Any distance measure accepted by stats::dist is acceptable.
quantile

If type = "quantile", specify the quantile to be estimates with a number between 0 and 1.
verbose

Default is FALSE. If TRUE, additional results will be returned as attributes, and more detailed errors will be printed.
...

Additional arguments to be passed to model.FUN function call.

Value

A vector with the estimated (i.e. kernel-smoothed) outcomes.

Contents
